properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms this evening that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-10T08:13:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T23:25:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2379321061.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:46 p.m. ADT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. Radar indicates that between 20 mm and 30 mm of rain will fall over the next hour. Potential rainfall rates: in excess of 25 mm/h. Total rainfall: possibly 35 mm. Potential wind gusts:70-90 km/h. Locations: 25 km northwest of St. Quentin, heading south-southeast at 30 km/h to lie near Plaster Rock by 8:45 pm ADT. Time span: ending by 9:30 pm ADT. Remarks:A severe thunderstorm with heavy downpours, followed by small hail and gusty winds will move away from the county in the next hours. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:35 p.m. ADT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A line of thunderstorms over the northwest will sweep southeast, giving mainly heavy rain, currently with some small hail. Maximum rainfall rates: in excess of 25 mm/h. Total rainfall: 20 to 50 mm Maximum hail size: near 2 cm. Maximum wind gusts up to 90 km/h : Locations: A line of thunderstorms extending from Neguac southwest to Renous, moving southeast at 45 km/h. Time span: ending by this evening. Remarks: A line of three thunderstorms is moving southeast across Miramichi County, with the highest threat for rainfall amounts, followed by hail, and some gusty winds. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

Description: At 5:43 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 45 kilometres south of Peawanuck to 165 kilometres east of Webequie to 150 kilometres west of Fort Albany, moving northeast at 75 km/h. Locations impacted include: Peawanuck, North Washagami Lake, Spruce Lake and Opinnagau Lake. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.
Expires: 2020-07-10T00:44:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T21:44:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1842715125.2020
Area: Peawanuck, Webequie, Fort Hope - Lansdowne House - Ogoki

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:15 p.m. CDT (6:15 p.m. EST, 7:15 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 20 kilometres southwest of North Caribou Lake to 12 kilometres west of Osnaburgh House, moving northeast at 75 km/h. Locations impacted include: Pipestone River Provincial Park, Pickle Lake, Horseshoe Lake, North Caribou Lake, Kitchenham Lake, Chilton Lake, Deshane Lake, Otoskwin Lake, Barrigar Lake, Opapimiskan Lake, Mamiegowish Lake, Central Patricia and Menako Lakes. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:15 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 110 kilometres north of Sachigo Lake to 50 kilometres west of Severn River Provincial Park to 95 kilometres north of Pipestone River Provincial Park, moving northeast at 75 km/h. Locations impacted include: Severn River Provincial Park, Ney Lake, Echoing Lake, Ellard Lake, Rieder Lake, Blackbear Lake, Swan Lake, Garrett Lake, Bearskin Lake, Bearbone Lake, Severn Lake, Dinwiddie Lake and Misikeyask Lake. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2020-07-10T01:44:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T23:16:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0946983841.2020
